string.text:
The (Wild) Boar-12 is a relatively new development from the Hammer design team
Based on the time-tested design of the RPK machine-gun (produced at the same factory), it was created as a direct competitor to the popular Russian Saiga-12 series of rifles
Although its main purpose is for sport (practice shooting under IPSC rules) and home security, the Boar-12 has become a popular support weapon for law enforcement agencies
 • Ammunition:
 • 12x70 Tungsten Buckshot
 • 12x70 Buckshot
 • 12x76 Slug
 • 12x76 Dart
 • Magazine capacity: 20 rounds

• Ammunition:
 • .45 ACP FMJ
 • .45 ACP Hydra-Shok
 • Magazine capacity: 30 + 1 rounds
The UMP-45 Tactical is a blowback-operated, magazine-fed submachine gun firing from a closed bolt, with integrated silencer and Eotech scope.
The UMP-45 is chambered for larger cartridges and magazines than other submachine guns like the 9x19mm MP5,
to provide greater stopping power against unarmoured targets (albeit with a slightly lower effective range) than the MP5
A larger cartridge produces more recoil, making control more difficult in full-auto mode. To mitigate this, the cyclic rate of fire was reduced to 600 rounds/min

• Ammunition:
 • 9x39mm PAB9
 • 9x39mm SP-5
 • 9x39mm SP-6
 • 9x39mm Isomorphic
 • Magazine capacity: 30 rounds
 • Effective range 800 m
 • Rate of fire 890/min
• Rifle grenade M209
• Scope (x8.0)
• Integrated silencer
The gun was modelled on the standard Belgian Fabrique Nationale Herstal F2000 Automatic grenade launcher, at the request of SPN Naval officers.
Various artefacts are used in its manufacture, which significantly increases its performance characteristics.
Evidence of their supply into the Zone was found at the crash site of a military helicopter.
Finding one, however, is another matter...

• Ammunition:
 • 5.56x45mm SS190
 • 5.56x45mm AP
 • 5.56x45mm R
 • Rate of fire 1250/min
 • Effective range 250 m
 • Muzzle velocity 970 m/s
 • This machine gun was designed by Belgian FN Herstel in the late 1970's - 80's. it is in service in many countries such as Belgium and the U.S. ( under the designation M249 saw). Minimi - easy (manual) machine-gun is based on the vapor-automatic with rotating bolt.

• Ammunition:
 • 9x39mm PAB9
 • 9x39mm SP-5
 • 9x39mm SP-6
 • 9x39mm Isomorphic
 • Magazine capacity: 25 rounds
• Effective range 600m
• Rate of fire: 600/min
Tactical Vintorez with Eotech red dot colimator, with possibility to attach
 • ELCAN digital hunting scope

• Ammunition:
 • 2mm Gauss capsules
 • Magazine capacity: 20 rounds
 • Effective Range: 1000m
This M72 Gauss Rifle, once belonging to the Stalker known as Ghost, was found lying in a Fruit Punch anomaly - which has permanently altered its firing characteristics. It now possesses a furious rate of fire in comparison with normal Gauss Rifles, whose slow recharge rate makes them effectively useless in combat after one shot. A unique and powerful weapon, to be handled with extreme caution

• Ammunition:
 • 2mm Gauss capsules
 • Magazine capacity: 20 rounds
 • Effective Range: 1000m
The VGI Ghost Stealth Gauss Rifle has, for a long time, been the primary choice for stealth operations, and was successfully tested in conjunction with the Ghost stealth outfit. This weapon has all the good qualities of its predecessor, the M72 Gauss Ghost, plus some additional ones achieved by immersing it in various anomalies. In addition to possessing a higher rate of fire in comparison with normal Gauss Rifles, it is almost invisible in daylight
Silencer for the Heckler and Koch G3 rifle
Silencer for the unique Zone weapon, the SCAR Crysis
Silencer created specially for the USP pistol variants

HK79 Grenade Launcher, designed by the German company Heckler and Koch for installation on their rifles such as the 7.62mm G3, and the 5.56mm HK33 and G41.
Used primarily by the German and Norwegian armed forces, this single-shot, 40mm launcher has a rifled steel barrel that is hinged to the launcher frame at the front, and can be tipped down at the back for loading.
The firing mechanism is cocked manually, and has a manual safety catch at the back. The trigger is on the left of the launcher, above the barrel. The rear 'ladder' sight is clamped to the top of the rifle, and has markings for 50m to 350m.
The HK79 is suitable for all types of low-velocity 40mm grenades, including fragmentation, anti-tank, flare, smoke, tear gas, and rubber pellet rounds
This particular model utilizes a computerized scope system with variable zoom

POSP 3-9x42V relates to an optical sight, which can be used in the dark with a built-in backlight
Adjustment knobs provide for lateral and angular correction
The alternating colour reticle illumination rangefinder lets you easily determine the distance to the subject under observation
The internal part of the body is filled with nitrogen, which prevents the formation of moisture on the lenses inside, and possible corrosion of metal components
Uses the standard SVD dovetail mount
Designed for use on the SVU-AS sniper rifle
'Zrak' is the optical sight specially designed for the Zastava family of sniper rifles
Infrared head for optical sights, used for accurate aiming in darkness
Hensoldt Fero-Z 24. 4 x multiple optical sight on a HK STANAG claw mount, designed for installation on HK G3 and G41 assault rifles, as well as the MP5 submachine gun
Powerful Night Vision goggles.\nRecharge time improved by using the latest Li-ion battery technology, and a more efficient transducer

Military Spec Ops AN-M83 Phosphor grenades
• Lighting range: 10m
• Lit time: approx 60 sec
Based on the AN-M83 HC white smoke hand grenade
Grenade body is made mostly from fibreglass, and contains a filler with chemical agents needed to obtain glowing light effects in various colours after ignition
Available in four colours:
• Military AN-M83R - Red
• Military AN-M83B - Blue
• Military AN-M83G - Green
• Military AN-M83Y - Yellow
All versions must be be treated with extreme care, and may activate if dropped or impacted!
